New Records: Kusal Perera slammed the fastest half-century of ICC World Cup 2023 on just 21 balls.
The partnership for the final wicket between Dilshan Madushanka and Maheesh Theekshana made 42 runs in 81 balls, which is the longest partnership for the final wicket in the history of ICC World Cup.
Key Match Events: New Zealand thrashed Sri Lanka by 5 wickets with 160 balls remaining.
Trent Boult clinched 3 crucial wickets, dismissing Kusal Mendis, Sadeera Samarawickrama, and Charith Asalanka.
Lockie Ferguson took the big wicket of Kusal Perera.
Mitchell Santner took the wickets of Angelo Mathews and Dhananjaya de Silva.
New Zealand openers Devon Conway (45) and Rachin Ravindra (42) gave a brilliant start.
Daryl Mitchell scored 43 runs and Glenn Phillips ensured New Zealand's victory in just 23.2 overs.
Angelo Mathews took 2 wickets for Sri Lanka.
Trent Boult was awarded ‘Player of the Match’ for his brilliant bowling figures of 3/37 in 10 overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand's victory in this match brought them closer to the semi-finals with 10 points in 9 matches and a net run rate of (+)0.743.
If New Zealand qualifies, they will face India at Mumbai's Wankhede on 15 November for the Semi-Finals.
If Pakistan qualifies, they will clash with India on 16 November at Eden Gardens.
Sri Lanka's tail-end batters held their ground well and took the team to a fightable score of 171 runs.
